title: Jeju Island
summary: Jeju Island (Korean: 제주도; Hanja: 濟州島; IPA: [tɕedzudo]) is the largest island in South Korea, located in Jeju Province (Jeju Special Self-Governing Province). The island covers an area of 1,833.2 km2 (707.8 sq mi), which is 1.83 percent of the total area of South Korea. In 2020, the resident registration population is about 670,000, the largest among the islands in South Korea.[2][3]
